Statement2: The charter further provided that the five nations that were then the major powers would permanently have sole authority to cast vetoes. Statement3: The reason given for this arrangement was that the burden of maintaining world peace would rest on the world's major powers, and no nation should be required to assume the burden of enforcing a decision it found repugnant.
Premise1: No nation that was not among the major powers at the end of the second world war would become a major power
Premise2: Decisions reached by a majority of nations in response to threats to world peace would be biased in favor of one or more major powers

Statement2: The charter further provided that the five nations that were then the major powers would permanently have sole authority to cast vetoes. Statement3: The reason given for this arrangement was that the burden of maintaining world peace would rest on the five major powers, and and the decision made by security council won't be biased in favor of any major powers.

input_info.Om: Premise2: Decisions reached by a majority of nations in response to threats to world peace would be biased in favor of one or more major powers

input_info.P: Statement1: After the second world war, the charter of the newly formed united nations established an eleven-member security council and charged it with taking collective action in response to threats to world peace. Statement2: The charter further provided that the five nations that were then the major powers would permanently have sole authority to cast vetoes. Statement3: The reason given for this arrangement was that the burden of maintaining world peace would rest on the world's major powers, and no nation should be required to assume the burden of enforcing a decision it found repugnant.

Statement3: This has hurt tenare's tourism industry, which is second only to its fishing industry in annual revenues. Statement4: In order to help the economy, therefore, the mayor of the island has proposed an ongoing program to kill any tiger sharks within a mile of the beaches.

Premise2: Not all tourists who come to tenare island enjoy swimming or surfing.

Please write the modified argument below:
output: Statement1: Tiger sharks are common in the waters surrounding tenare island. Statement2: Usually tiger sharks feed on smaller sharks, but sometimes they have attacked tourists swimming and surfing at tenare's beaches. Statement3: If all the tourists were attacked by tiger sharks, it would cause damage to tenare's tourism industry, which is second only to its fishing industry in annual revenues. Statement4: In order to help the economy, therefore, the mayor of the island has proposed an ongoing program to kill any tiger sharks within a mile of the beaches.

input_info.Q: Which of the following, if true, most strongly calls into question the likelihood that implementation of the mayor's proposal will have the desired consequence?
input_info.Om: Premise2: Not all tourists who come to tenare island enjoy swimming or surfing.

input_info.P: Statement1: Tiger sharks are common in the waters surrounding tenare island. Statement2: Usually tiger sharks feed on smaller sharks, but sometimes they have attacked tourists swimming and surfing at tenare's beaches. Statement3: This has hurt tenare's tourism industry, which is second only to its fishing industry in annual revenues. Statement4: In order to help the economy, therefore, the mayor of the island has proposed an ongoing program to kill any tiger sharks within a mile of the beaches.

input_info.P: Statement1: Tiger beetles are such fast runners that they can capture virtually any nonflying insect. input_info.O: Premise1: The truth of a purported scientific claim is not sufficient for it to be of scientific interest.
